I like how often people critique nerfs such as the Lee Sin movespeed changes + slight ult CD change, acting like Riot has no idea what they are doing.  Lets just ignore that Lee had an almost 3% drop in winrate from those changes.

At least let the changes go through before screaming.

As a side note Ahri changes went like this>

W 10% less AP scaling, across all 3 fires (which hit at 30% damage on additional bolts at the same target).  That is 30% less AP scaling across 3 targets, 23% Less scaling across 2, and 16% less Ap scaling vs a single target.

R: 5% less AP scaling, across her 3 bolts, which fire 3 times.  Up to 3 bolts can hit one target meaning that her ult caused a 15-45% AP scaling drop depending on the number of targets.

E: 10% AP scaling increase on the ability with 1.5 - 2.4 times the CD of W

In a full rotation of her spells Ahri lost 21% AP scaling vs a single target.  In team fights she lost 65% AP scaling lost.  Over a 10 second rotation of all of her abilities (So 2 Foxfires) she lost 27-95% AP scaling depending on the number of targets.

Just because it feels like a small nerf does not make it a small nerf.  

-------------------------------------

Think about how frequently Lucian goes OOM in lane, it is very often for an ADC, especially if they spam.  They use Q anywhere from 2-5+ times in a bit fight, most bot lane fights early on are 2-3 unless they are very short trades.  hitting the mana cost means he can use it less, which means less waveclear and less bullying.  That means he can't capitalize are strongly on won trades, and pushing him in hurts him a lot as he has to burn even more mana just to keep up, and as well already covered he burns more mana than just about any other adc.  

Hitting him in the mana hits him exactly where he needs it, but hurting his flexibility and limiting his ability to trade all the time.  Lucian is meant to deal damage, that is fine.  By limiting his mana pool you keep lucian strong in terms of power, but hit his laning phase quite hard and give incentive for him to go down the essence reaver path which weakens his laning phase further as well as focusing him around the mid-late game more so he can't run away with games so early.
They are just going to rush a E.R. on Lucian to compensate, and Ahri nerf reinforces LichTech build. Because Less AP ratios= more AA to kill target early.

Which are in turn a weaker and stronger build respectively which if they are building those the majority of the time that would mean the nerfs were meaningful and made an impact on their performance.

E.R. has a cost and is a major setback to his most effective build. So that'd be great if he had to build it.
Reinforcing ER while nerfing his current BorK/BC build was actually the point of the change, since one build is out of line and the other isn't used.
still a net nerf

It's still a net nerf, but so long as it increases the strength of his ER build path relative to his current one, it does what they set out to do. Even better, it differentiates the two paths more sharply - ER will give him plenty of spell-slinging, as per usual, while BorK/BC will allow him fewer casts, but more powerful ones.
Definitely a better Lucian overall agreed.
Praise be unto tradeoffs in build paths \o/
A 3% drop could also just be a natural drop from playing habits. 3% isn't enough to say squat about jack.
Actually it is pretty big, especially considering how popular Lee Sin is.  A 50% win rate is a fine champion, but a 47% winrate is a bad champion in a lot of people's eyes.

But you need to factor in how many 0 skill players picked lee up because he was THE OP jungler according to YouTube and streamers. These guys tend to underperform on the new champ they pick up and deflate it's winrate even if the champ is overtuned. Only when the champ is undeniably FREELO broken does winrate increase despite many new low skill players picking up the champ. That is when you see Riot stepping in right away with a hotfix.

But there was no sudden increase in play rate... There wasn't a huge influx of new Lee players that would have pulled his winrate down. The nerfs are the only major change that could explain the sudden drop.

A 3% drop after very few changes in his winrate for quite a while and with no nerfs to the items he uses.  Considering there wasn't much else that would have impacted him that patch other than Zac getting overbuffed I would say that it is safe to say his nerfs were responsible.

You generally don't see 3% drops in winrates after a general positive trend in a champ for the past few patches and attribute it to other stuff that wouldn't have directly affected him instead of the direct nerfs he received.
